Merge pull request #392 from ejmarino/patch-1

Update $pending object on async validations

Update $pending object on async validations

When a custom validator returns a promise, uiValidation directive adds the validation key to ModelController's $pending object.
When promise is resolve or rejected. $pending[key] is deleted automatically.

This allow to use $pending variable from the view to show transient messages while validation is taking place.

Merge pull request #245 from sjbarker/parser-required-error

bug(ui.mask): change required check in parser

bug(ui.mask): change required check in parser

Change parsers check for required error to an attribute check.

Before the parser checked to see if the controller.$error.required was defined.
If so, it would set the required validity to false. This doesn't work if
ng-required is used, because the control could have been required at one point
and is no longer required. Instead this checks if the elements attribute object
contains a required property and if said property is true.

BREAKING CHANGE: if you rely on ui-mask to invalidate an empty viewValue
this will no longer work. Please use the required attribute or ng-required
directive to specify whether the input is required.

Merge pull request #124 from kadamwhite/issue/119-scrollfix-memory-leak

Unbind uiScrollfix directive jQuery event handlers to prevent memory leaks

fix (uiScrollfix): Unbind event handlers to prevent memory leaks

The uiScrollfix directive will bind scroll event handlers to the window
object in the absence of a parent uiScrollfixTarget directive. These
event handlers were not removed when the directive was destroyed,
causing a memory leak.

We prevent this by removing bound jQuery scroll event handlers when the
scope is $destroyed. Unit tests have been updated to verify these events
are correctly removed.

Resolves #119

fix(mask): Formatter wasn't returning correct value

Added test for formatter

fix(mask): Removing 'space' caveat from previous fix

See code comment for more explanation with context.

fix(mask): Masks containing maskable chars bleed

Masks containing maskable chars, such as letters and numbers, had a
chance to "bleed" into the unmasked value as reported in issue #494.
I've fixed this from happening with the caveat that potentially
maskable chars need at least a space somewhere between it and the
non-mask chars to work accurately.

Dragging a selection and deleting/replacing it can still cause
bleeding, but I can't think of any way to fix that. At least it's
enough of an edge-case to be acceptable, in my opinion.
test(mask): All new uiMask tests, fix failing tests for IEs, Firefox

Merge pull request #486 from caiotoon/fix-keypress-custom-event

fix(keypress): allow events to ommit key modifiers
chore(keypress): test case events key modifiers are not defined by default
chore(keypress): changed `|| false` per `git add modules/directives/keypress/` where possible

fix(keypress): allow events to ommit key modifiers

Programmatically triggered events that do not include key modifiers (`altKey`, `shiftKey`, `ctrlKey`) properties would fail even when combination didn't require these keys.

fix(mask): NgModelController.$viewValue always properly set

Uninitializing mask now restores the model value to the input.
IinitializeElement() now uses $modelValue instead of $viewValue for
more accurate/consistent behavior. Fix bug with value parser was
setting for $viewValue.

In short, $viewValue will never be set to an empty mask. And
$modelValue is now King Hippo.

fix(mask): Force $viewValue, other edge case bug

$viewValue wasn't reflecting the element value after the eventHandler
finished processing the value. The raw value is now being masked and
set as the $viewValue so it will accurately reflect what the user sees
after a keypress.

Additionally, eventHandler altered the raw value in some cases; those
cases weren't $apply'ing the changed value as they should have been.

Merge pull request #442 from skahlert/patch-1

Fix synchronization between sorted list and model

As part of being a good citizen, a directive that uses NgModel, should (AFAIK)
use the correct values to render elements. Previously the select control
was using modelValue as opposed to viewValue inside the $render method.
This meant that cool tricks (like injecting parsers and formatters did
not work properly).

Also changed the directive initialisation to be more robust. In certain
cases the initial value was not being set correctly... meaning that on
recreation, any bound data would not show up properly.

Jq: Do not copy element options to the defaults

When using multiple Jq directives, elements options
(from ui-options attribute) are copied to the global default options
and then they are applied to all latter directive instances.

Parse datepicker into Date object

The string "2012-07-30T17:59:16.395Z" was not being parsed correctly by the jQuery UI datepicker. This fix allows the string to first be parsed into a Date object, which jQuery UI handles correctly.
